TopicTitle: Has anyone made it to space using only sepatrons?

Articles.Content:
I've managed about 2.5km with this thing:

If I use any more though, it explodes. Anyone do any better?

EDIT:I of course mean sub-orbit. I know theres no way in hell you could make orbit that way.

Actually, a year ago there was a challenge which asked exactly about this (i.e. how high can you get just with Sepratrons )

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/33370-Sepratron-Height-Challenge

I've managed about 2.5km with this thing:

https://fbcdn-sphotos-g-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpf1/t1.0-9/1977028_882838341730640_3762061949837138445_n.jpg

If I use any more though, it explodes. Anyone do any better?

EDIT:I of course mean sub-orbit. I know theres no way in hell you could make orbit that way.

Scott Manley's Fourth-of-July video begs to differ.

Edit: That said, he uses a probe brain, rather than a manned capsule.

Edited July 19, 2014 by maltesh

Scott Manley's Fourth-of-July video begs to differ.

Edit: That said, he uses a probe brain, rather than a manned capsule.

Wow! Never would have thought.

While I never tried going to space entirely on sepratrons, I did however during my early days of KSP try to complete an orbital burn with sepratrons. What I'd do is go high into space, decouple the launch stage, turn east, and fire as many sepratrons as I possibly could. Of course, it never worked. I still am amazed at how bad I was at this game.
